page.title: 03BASSINGBOURN-CUM-KNEESWORTH
page.content: You enter Kneesworth by the A14 or the Causeway or Chestnut Lane. In Kneesworth there are two pubs a shop and two estates. The estates are {Canberra Close}and{Wellington Place. There is also a reservoir and a farm. There have been two new houses built and some old houses are being rebuilt. There is a big house called Kneesworth House. It has been sold to some Americans. They plan to use it as a psychiatric hospital. The villagers don't like the idea. Kneesworth is very small. Between 120 and 130 people live there. As you walk up hill along Chestnut Lane, to your left is a farm track leading to Whaddon. Frog Hall and Fountain Farm are two old buildings. In Frog Hall there is the original bread oven. Fountain Farm has an old artesian well.
